question.title: How to hide api routes generated by swagger?
question.body: I really couldn't figure this one out on my own and I didn't find any answer on the internet neither so I'll try it here. Swagger is showing me lots of controllers that I have not created and I have no idea where they come from. They are clogging up my api documentation and I would really like to get rid of all of them and only keep the API routes I explicitly declared. They are all called either name-controller, name-entity-controller or name-search-controller, with name being the name of an entity. Here is an example of controllers I want to get rid of in the swagger ui.

answers.body:
To hide API routes in Swagger, you can use annotations or configuration options in Java

Option 1. Using springdoc-openapi (Recommended for Spring Boot 2.2+)

Add this Maven dependency (if not present in pom.xml):

<dependency>
  <groupId>org.springdoc</groupId>
  <artifactId>springdoc-openapi-ui</artifactId>
  <version>1.7.0</version>
</dependency>

Use @Hidden annotation.
Just annotate your controller or method with @Hidden.

import io.swagger.v3.oas.annotations.Hidden;

@RestController
@Hidden // hides entire controller
public class InternalController {
  
    @GetMapping("/internal/health")
    public String healthCheck() {
        return "OK";
    }
}

-> You can also hide just specific methods:

@RestController
public class MyController {
  
    @Hidden
    @GetMapping("/secret")
    public String secretEndpoint() {
        return "Hidden";
    }
  
    @GetMapping("/public")
    public String publicEndpoint() {
        return "Visible in Swagger";
    }
}

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Option 2. Using Springfox (Swagger 2 or 3)

Add this Maven dependency (if not present in pom.xml):

<dependency>
    <groupId>io.springfox</groupId>
    <artifactId>springfox-boot-starter</artifactId>
    <version>3.0.0</version>
</dependency>

Use @ApiIgnore

import springfox.documentation.annotations.ApiIgnore;
  
@RestController
@ApiIgnore // hides entire controller
public class HiddenController {
  
    @GetMapping("/internal")
    public String internal() {
        return "Hidden";  
    }
}

-> Or for individual endpoints:

@RestController
public class MyController {
  
    @ApiIgnore
    @GetMapping("/hidden")
    public String hiddenMethod() {
        return "This won't appear in Swagger";
    }
  
    @GetMapping("/shown")
    public String shownMethod() {
        return "This will appear";
    }
}
